content.description:
A River God’s Instructions

Surge age, nate1 dea, primisque cadentibus sideribus 
Iunoni fer riterite, adv.: properly precesprex, precis, f.: prayer, iramque minasmina, -ae, f.: threatque 
supplicibussupplex, -icis, adj.: humble supera votis. Mihi victor honorem
persolvespersolvo, -ere = solvo, -ere. Ego sum pleno quem flumine cernescerno, -ere = video, -ere.
 1:refers to Aeneas↩
content.question: In lines 1-2 (Surge...preces), what word is in the vocative case?

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
